articles.title: WOTM :sam-sapertein
articles.summary: Sam Saperstein, Head of Women on the Move at JPMorgan Chase, discusses the theme of resilience at the 2021 Women on the Move Leadership Day. She highlights inspiring stories of women who have reinvented themselves in the face of adversity, including a Paralympian and a small business owner who pivoted during the pandemic. The article also showcases JPMorgan Chase's achievements in supporting women, such as exceeding its $10 billion lending goal to women-owned small businesses and implementing programs to support female employees and underserved segments.

articles.title: JPMorgan buys 49% stake in Greek payments company
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired a 49% stake in the Greek fintech Viva Wallets as part of its ongoing acquisition strategy. The Athens-based company provides payment solutions to small and medium-sized businesses across 23 European countries. This investment, valued over $1.15 billion, will help Viva Wallets expand its localized payment services throughout Europe.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase: Driving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase is leveraging its supply chain to drive diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly focusing on supporting Black, Hispanic, and Latino suppliers through a US$30bn commitment to close the racial wealth gap. The firm aims to increase diverse supplier spend by US$6bn, with US$1.2bn dedicated to Black, Hispanic, and Latino-owned businesses, and is developing initiatives like a cyber-readiness program with TruSight and a grant program to help diverse businesses meet industry requirements. These efforts demonstrate JPMorgan Chase's commitment to making diversity an integral part of its procurement strategy and fostering inclusive growth within the business community.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase: Driving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase is leveraging its supply chain and a US$30 billion commitment to enhance diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly for Black, Hispanic, and Latino suppliers. The firm aims to increase spending with diverse businesses, requiring its top suppliers to do the same, and is addressing barriers such as cyber-readiness and access to capital through new programs and partnerships. These initiatives are designed to foster economic inclusion and drive cultural shifts across the business community.

articles.title: JPMorgan buys 49% stake in Greek fintech Viva Wallet
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase has acquired a 49% stake in the Greek fintech Viva Wallet, continuing its strategy of investing in banking-adjacent businesses, especially internationally. This investment is part of JPMorgan's aggressive acquisition strategy, particularly as regulations limit its ability to acquire more U.S.-based deposit-taking institutions. Viva Wallet, valued at over $2 billion, provides services to small and medium-sized businesses across 23 European countries.

articles.title: Income Is The Outcome
articles.summary: The article discusses the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income Fund, an income-oriented fund that uses equity-linked notes (ELNs) and options premiums to generate substantial income for investors. Despite underperforming market benchmarks in total return, its strategy prioritizes income generation and aims to reduce volatility, allowing investors to stay invested in equities in a more defensive manner. The fund's co-portfolio manager, Hamilton Reiner, explains how the use of ELNs converts options premiums into bona fide income and how market volatility influences the income generated.

articles.title: Throwing up the white flag? Retail investors dumped stocks at Monday's open, JPMorgan analysis finds
articles.summary: A JPMorgan analysis found that retail investors aggressively dumped stocks at Monday's open, leading to a retail order imbalance of $1.36 billion by noon. This suggests a potential surrender by retail investors in the current market. The analysis was conducted by markets strategist Peng Cheng.

articles.title: Building a New Sustainability Model for the Food Industry
articles.summary: Maple Leaf Foods, a major protein company, is striving to become the most sustainable in the world by setting science-based targets like reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 30% by 2030 and achieving carbon neutrality. The company is investing in environmentally conscious production facilities, sustainable meat practices, and plant-based proteins, including using an ESG-linked credit facility from J.P. Morgan to support its growth initiatives. Maple Leaf Foods emphasizes a "shared value" framework where business and social decisions are intertwined, aiming to prove that carbon neutrality can be both possible and profitable in the food industry.

articles.title: CAF grants A/B loan for USD 300 million to YPF S.A. to support its climate change adaptation and mitigation strategy
articles.summary: CAF has granted an A/B loan of USD 300 million to YPF S.A. to support its climate change adaptation and mitigation strategy. This financing marks YPF's return to the international financial market and aligns with its emissions reduction goals. The loan structure mobilized private capital from Santander, Itau Unibanco, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited, and Cargill Financial Services International.

articles.title: loanDepot Announces Closing Of $597M Securitization
articles.summary: loanDepot announced the closing of Mello Mortgage Capital Acceptance 2022-INV1, a $597 million securitization of agency-eligible mortgages originated through its retail and partner channels. This transaction marks over $3 billion in private label residential mortgage-backed securities sponsored by loanDepot entities over the past twelve months. The securitization consists of 1,442 prime mortgage loans made to borrowers with strong credit profiles, demonstrating the company's resilient business model and capital-raising strategy.

articles.title: Future Returns: How Goldman Sachs Approaches Direct Indexing
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing trend of direct indexing in asset management, highlighted by Fidelity's new low-minimum product and previous acquisitions by major firms. It explains how Goldman Sachs, a long-time provider of direct indexing, personalizes portfolios for tax efficiency and individual values, managing $118 billion in this strategy. The piece also delves into the differences between direct indexing and traditional active management, emphasizing its tailored approach to client goals rather than purely seeking market outperformance.

articles.title: Crypto Lending and the Search for Yield
articles.summary: This article explores the landscape of crypto lending, detailing how investors can earn yield by lending digital assets like Bitcoin and stablecoins to various entities. It discusses the primary sources of this yield, including futures-based "cash and carry" trades and arbitrage opportunities, while also analyzing the macro and micro risks involved, such as market volatility and counterparty risk. The author emphasizes the importance of traditional credit analysis in navigating this evolving financial market.

articles.title: Pinnacle Expands to North Fulton County in Atlanta
articles.summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners is expanding its operations to North Fulton County in Atlanta, establishing a temporary presence and planning a full-service location for summer. The firm has hired a team of banking veterans, led by Scott Jordan as area manager, to serve clients in North Fulton, Gwinnett, and Forsyth Counties. This expansion is part of Pinnacle's broader growth strategy in Atlanta, building on its entry into the market two years prior.

articles.title: Citigroup is hiring across Gulf, awaits another record IPO year
articles.summary: Citigroup is expanding its presence in the Gulf region, anticipating that 2022 will surpass 2021 as a record year for activity, including initial public offerings. The bank is adding resources in Saudi Arabia and Dubai to capitalize on the region's booming IPO market and diversifying economies. Amid a wider war for talent in the banking industry, Citigroup believes it can continue to attract skilled professionals due to its strong institution and management.

articles.title: Inviu, la fintech de inversiones del Galicia, nombró nuevo CFO y ya piensa en regionalizarse
articles.summary: Inviu, the investment fintech of Grupo Financiero Galicia, has appointed Ignacio Clancy as its new CFO. Clancy, with a strong background in financial services and capital markets, will be responsible for regionalizing the company and mitigating project risks. Inviu aims to expand its operations beyond Argentina, building on Clancy's extensive experience, including his tenure at JP Morgan.

articles.title: Fidelity Plots Crypto Industry, Metaverse ETFs
articles.summary: Fidelity Investments has filed proposals with the SEC for two new ETFs: the Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments ETF, and the Fidelity Metaverse ETF. These filings come shortly after the SEC denied Fidelity's application for a spot bitcoin trust, highlighting the company's continued efforts to expand its offerings in the digital asset space without directly investing in cryptocurrencies for these new ETFs. The proposed ETFs will track indices of companies involved in the crypto industry and those developing metaverse-related products or services.

articles.title: Nuveen Names Saira Malik As Chief Investment Officer
articles.summary: Nuveen has promoted Saira Malik to Chief Investment Officer, a newly created role, where she will drive strategic market and investment insights for the firm's $1.2 trillion assets. Malik will also lead the global investment committee and maintain leadership for Nuveen’s $450 billion global equity business. With 26 years of experience, she will continue as lead portfolio manager for the CREF Stock strategy and a listed portfolio manager for CREF Growth and CREF Global Equities strategies.

articles.title: Digital Wallets and Financial Services Disruption
articles.summary: Digital wallets are significantly disrupting traditional financial services, including banking, brokerage, and lending, due to superior user experiences and lower customer acquisition costs. ARK Investment Management predicts substantial growth for digital wallets, projecting their market capitalization to reach $5.7 trillion in the U.S. and $20 trillion globally within five years. Companies like Block (Square) and PayPal, which are major holdings in the ARK Fintech Innovation ETF (ARKF), are leading this disruption by acquiring customers at a fraction of the cost of traditional banks.

articles.title: OCC approves national bank charter applications of fintech company
articles.summary: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has conditionally approved applications from Social Finance Inc. (SoFi) to establish SoFi Bank, National Association. This move brings SoFi under federal bank regulatory supervision, subjecting it to comprehensive regulations including the Community Reinvestment Act. The approval requires the new bank not to engage in crypto-asset activities, and SoFi Technologies is seeking to become a bank holding company.
